content:
Further Setup for Salesforce Knowledge

Itâ€™s time to keep building your knowledge base. You can add workflows and approvals, track field history, and add validation rules.

Required Editions: Available in Essentials and Unlimited Editions with Service Cloud, available for an additional cost in Professional, Enterprise, Performance, and Developer Editions.

Knowledge Settings
Create a knowledge base experience for support agents, partners, and customers.
Knowledge Scalability
Every article can have multiple versions and translations, affecting org limits when scaling.
Control Data Integrity with Validation Rules
Ensure article content compliance with company standards by creating validation rules for each article type.
Define Validation Status Picklist Values
Create picklist values to show the state of articles (e.g., Validated, Not Validated).
Modify Default Category Group Assignments for Articles
Assign category groups to Salesforce Knowledge articles and use data categories to classify articles.
Filter Articles with Data Category Mapping
Map case fields to data categories to filter suggested articles by category or product.
Workflow and Approvals for Articles
Implement approval processes for article publication and control content.
Custom Fields for Articles
Create custom fields for articles, choosing the field type first.
Field-Level Security on Articles
Restrict readers' access to specific fields on detail and edit pages with field-level security.
Article History Tracking (Lightning Experience)
Track article history, including version histories and article events.
Article History Tracking (Salesforce Classic)
Track article history, including version histories and article events.

Set Up Knowledge Component Actions
Share article contents or links from Salesforce and Experience Cloud sites using knowledge component actions.
Set Up Knowledge for Enhanced LWR Sites
Help customers self-serve with Knowledge pages and components in enhanced LWR sites.
title: Further Setup for Salesforce Knowledge
